Use it or lose it

Dec 26, 2017

I want to undestand how our mind works and what are the reasons for our feelings. Woudn’t it be nice if we could control our feelings?

Recently I noticed that I intentionally defer doing one specific task. But why?

This task involves using a tool I started learning how to use before 10 months. But

9 months ago I started learning Elixir. I had great fun with it, but I stopped using it 5 months ago.

I have to use the language soon again, but

I have

I have a big queue of tasks waiting for me to complete them. But what is their order? Which task do I do next? Usually the tasks with the nearest deadline have the highest priority. But there are ta

why do i fear of something? for example i have been writing in the programming language Elixir i had a great experience before 7 months but since the i haven’t touched the language a lot of time has passed now i have to do a project in that language and i am scared, i fear the project, the language… why? it is because a lot of time has passed and i am not as confident in my knowledge as before it means that it has escaped my comfort zone it’s use it or you lose it i would have to struggle again to expand my comfort zone

we can imagine the universe of all skills and knowledge like nature it grows wild as time passes, if humans don’t interact with nature for example i have the skill of programming in Elixir when i have started learning it, i went into the wild i had to expand my comfort zone because i am not comfortable in the wild with all these poisonous plants and dangerous animals i had to carefully build my comfort zone there under the form of a house/building the bigger and the more secure the building, the bigger and more secure the comfort zone for Elixir i managed to build a wooden 1-floored cabin without windows and thus after 4 months plants weaved around it and animals started living in the small house this is because the owner of the house didn’t maintain it the master of this zone didn’t use it, so he lost it he would have to build it again

but on the bright side, he already has experience building this house he/she can now build it even better, even faster :)
